I thought about [[Explorer's Scope]] for Etali as another scry-style effect, but one that also let's me stack the triggers and put any lands into play off the top and hope to get a better spell. It's not great, I know, but it is an attack trigger, so I get to do it on each of my extra attack steps.

attachments.fallback: Explorer's Scope {1} // Artifact — Equipment // Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped. // Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
attachments.text:
Artifact — Equipment
Whenever equipped creature attacks, look at the top card of your library. If it's a land card, you may put it onto the battlefield tapped.

text: Actually his Scry being tied to an attack trigger works well for Etali...he just won’t survive without help.
I like Red getting abilities tied to attacking.
Far more than combat damage.
It also fits characteristically better, I think. Reckless attacking vs. “smart” attacking per se
Yeah. Give Red value for attacking whether they hit or not.
it’s also stronger in general
Sure.
well, all other things being equal
the attack trigger is stronger because you have control over that for the most part
but that does mean the damage against player triggers can have stronger effects because it is less sure
But it also encourages more impulsive attacks which is very Red. They don’t care if they actually hit but just want to spin the wheel.
yup
<https://scryfall.com/search?q=id%3C%3Dr+o%3Ascry&order=edhrec> a better search for actual use cases
